headlines.text: The internet is heavy. This is not.
The clouds are doing something unrepeatable right now.
The specific, low-stakes relief of a plan being cancelled.
You’re real. Your tabs are not. Both feel equally urgent.
Nobody is waiting for a reply right now.
The world is loud. This is the quiet part.
Somewhere, a dog is having a very successful nap.
Most conversations don’t actually need a follow-up.
The light hit the wall in a way that felt almost intentional.
You survived another series of meetings that could have been avoided.
The group chat will survive without you today.
The 'no unread messages' version of peace and quiet.
You made it to the afternoon. That is plenty.
Someone misunderstood you earlier. It’s already fading.
The way a house sounds when it’s finally, actually quiet.
You exist, which is a statistically significant occurrence.
The world is unhinged. You are gently hinged.
No one is actually tracking your response time.
The sun doesn't care about your inbox. It is doing its thing anyway.
Just a moment to acknowledge that you are here, and that counts.
Glad you found your way back to the calmest three inches of glass in your pocket.
Still a person with a phone and a posture problem.
The algorithm doesn't know you as well as it thinks it does.
A brief intermission from having to be 'on.'
You don't need a position on every story you see today.
The trees are doing their thing regardless of your inbox.
The floor is holding you up without asking for credit.
The windows are reflecting light you’re not currently looking at.
Most people are too busy worrying about themselves to judge you.
The shadows are moving across the floor, even if you aren’t.
Your favorite mug is sitting exactly where you left it.
Clean sheets and a room that is exactly the right temperature.
You don't have to be the funny one today.
You don’t need to be interesting for anyone right now.
The world outside is louder than your notifications.
There are plants growing without anybody watching.
The specific satisfaction of a quiet kitchen at night.
You are allowed to be unremarkable today.
The day will end at the same time regardless of how much you do.
Not every hour needs defending.
The earth turned. You turned with it.
Reality showed up. You did too.
Another day of free-range consciousness.
Life remains weirdly specific today.
Everything is temporary, which is actually pretty great news.
There are birds conducting their entire lives outside your awareness.
You can be as medium about today as you want.
You can leave that read receipt on read.
The world is not waiting for your take on this.
You're here. That's the whole headline.
